title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 645-6.9 - Stipulations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 645-6.9 - Stipulations

State Regulations
(a) At any time
after publication of a notice of hearing, the hearing officer may request that
the parties attempt to stipulate to an agreement that will resolve specified
issues and result in withdrawal of objections, limiting the scope of the
subject matter, or in the discontinuance of the hearing. (b) Such stipulations shall be incorporated
into the record of the hearing or agreed to in writing by the involved parties
and filed with the hearing officer. (c) Such stipulations do not alter the
responsibility of the commission to make a determination on the application
consistent with all applicable laws and regulations. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
§§
645-6.9

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
